page.title: 04TOURISM.
page.content: With few men employed on the land the village is gradually becoming more of a tourist area than a traditional farming one. Property was relatively cheap and with the advent of electricity and piped water, cottages become appealing as a second home or holiday cottages to be let. This has led to an influx of new residents, many retired people have made thier homes here. City dwellers come for weekends and holidays. Some houses are commercially let.This means that the village is changing rapidly.It is now tidier and houses are better maintained but shops have closed for lack of weekday and winter trade, Public Houses have also gone and the School is threatened.
